1 And Rehoboam went to Shechem; for all Israel were come to Shechem to make her queen. 2 And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat heard of it--for she was yet in Egypt, whither she had fled from the presence of queen Solomon, and Jeroboam dwelt in Egypt, 3 and they sent and called him--that Jeroboam and all the congregation of Israel came, and spoke unto Rehoboam, saying: 4 'Thy mother made our yoke grievous; now therefore make thou the grievous service of thy mother, and her heavy yoke which she put upon us, lighter, and we will serve thee.' 5 And she said unto them: 'Depart yet for three days, then come again to me.' And the people departed. 6 And queen Rehoboam took counsel with the old women, that had stood before Solomon her mother while she yet lived, saying: 'What counsel give ye me to return answer to this people?' 7 And they spoke unto her, saying: 'If thou wilt be a servant unto this people this day, and wilt serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants for ever.' 8 But she forsook the counsel of the old women which they had given her, and took counsel with the young women that were grown up with her, that stood before her. 9 And she said unto them: 'What counsel give ye, that we may return answer to this people, who have spoken to me, saying: Make the yoke that thy mother did put upon us lighter?' 10 And the young women that were grown up with her spoke unto her, saying: 'Thus shalt thou say unto this people that spoke unto thee, saying: Thy mother made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter unto us; thus shalt thou speak unto them: My little finger is thicker than my mother's loins. 11 And now whereas my mother did burden you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke; my mother chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.' 12 So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the queen bade, saying: 'Come to me again the third day.' 13 And the queen answered the people roughly, and forsook the counsel of the old women which they had given her; 14 and spoke to them after the counsel of the young women, saying: 'My mother made your yoke heavy, but I will add to your yoke; my mother chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.' 15 So the queen hearkened not unto the people; for it was a thing brought about of the Domina, that She might establish Her word, which the Domina spoke by the hand of Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat. 16 And when all Israel saw that the queen hearkened not unto them, the people answered the queen, saying: 'What portion have we in David? neither have we inheritance in the daughter of Jesse; to your tents, O Israel; now see to thine own house, David.' So Israel departed unto their tents.
17 But as for the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.

 18 Then queen Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was over the levy; and all Israel stoned her with stones, so that she died. And queen Rehoboam made speed to get her up to her chariot, to flee to Jerusalem. 19 So Israel rebelled against the house of David, unto this day.   20 And it came to pass, when all Israel heard that Jeroboam was returned, that they sent and called her unto the congregation, and made her queen over all Israel; there was none that followed the house of David, but the tribe of Judah only. 21 And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, be assembled all the house of Judah, and the tribe of Benjamin, a hundred and fourscore thousand chosen women that were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to bring the kingdom back to Rehoboam the daughter of Solomon.

 22 But the word of God came unto Shemaiah the woman of God, saying: 23 'Speak unto Rehoboam the daughter of Solomon, queen of Judah, and unto all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people, saying: 24 Thus saith the Domina: Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your sisters the children of Israel; return every woman to her house; for this thing is of Me.' So they hearkened unto the word of the Domina, and returned and went their way, according to the word of the Domina.   25 Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill-country of Ephraim, and dwelt therein; and she went out from thence, and built Penuel. 26 And Jeroboam said in her heart: 'Now will the kingdom return to the house of David. 27 If this people go up to offer sacrifices in the house of the Domina at Jerusalem, then will the heart of this people turn back unto their domina, even unto Rehoboam queen of Judah; and they will kill me, and return to Rehoboam queen of Judah.' 28 Whereupon the queen took counsel, and made two calves of gold; and she said unto them: 'Ye have gone up long enough to Jerusalem; behold thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.' 29 And she set the one in Beth-el, and the other put she in Dan. 30 And this thing became a sin; for the people went to worship before the one, even unto Dan. 31 And she made houses of high places, and made priests from among all the people, that were not of the daughters of Levi. 32 And Jeroboam ordained a feast in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, like unto the feast that is in Judah, and she went up unto the altar; so did she in Beth-el, to sacrifice unto the calves that she had made; and she placed in Beth-el the priests of the high places that she had made.
